This whole video is absolutely worth watching in it's entirety! For those that want/need it, a timeline:
0:00) Intro with Laura (Host & Science Reporter)
2:08) Video 1: California Oak Moths
6:10) Video 2: Two Spotted Spider Mites (Mites on Drones)
10:22) Q&A about CA Oak Moths/Meet Gabby (Coordinating Producer) & Peter (Entomologist from UC Davis, if I'm hearing correctly?)
11:35) Why do CA Oak Moths lay eggs on some trees & not others?
12:45) Will the CA Oak Moth irritate skin?
13:20) Do other caterpillars do this (hang from single strand of silk)?
14:20) Why don't moths birth baby moths instead of caterpillars?
16:08) Do certain moths like certain tree species?
17:10) Are there any benefits that the caterpillars provide to the trees?
18:05) Do moths prefer trees in certain conditions?
19:10) Q&A about the Mites, Meet Josh (Lead Producer & Cinematographer) & Christian (Entomologist from UC Davis, I think...my apologies if incorrect!)
19:25) How did Josh learn about this epic mite battle?
20:40) Why are drones becoming so prevalent with agriculture & crops these days?
24:30) Are there concerns the predator mites might leave the fields and become an invasive species?
26:20) When the predatory mites die, are their bodies useful to the plants?
27:06) Video 3: Long-Horned Beach Hoppers (aka Sand Fleas)
31:16) Video 4: Death Cap (aka Deadly Mushrooms)
34:58) Learn more about Beach Hoppers with Mike (Producer and Post Production Coordinator) & Jenny (University of California, Santa Barbara)
35:16) How'd Mike come across Jenny's Beach Hopper research?
37:08) What are the biggest threats to Beach Hopper populations?
38:35) What is a Beach Hopper's defense mechanism?
39:10) Why is there such a variation in size?
40:13) How do we know Beach Hoppers only see shapes?
41:27) Why are the Beach Hoppers' antennae pinkish-red, does it benefit them in any way?
42:20) Q&A about Death Cap Mushrooms with Gabby (Produced the video) & Ann Pringle (Dept of Botany @ University of Wisconsin, Madison)
42:34) How did Gabby learn about Death Caps?
44:20) What has Ann's research found regarding getting rid of Death Cap Mushrooms?
46:50) How does Death Cap destroy your liver?
48:17) Often organisms use bright colors &/or patterns to indicate toxicity/poisonous, do mushrooms do this as well? If so, why does the Death Cap appear so bland?
49:24) Are there any creatures that can eat these mushrooms without getting poisoned?
50:15) More Beach Hopper questions with Jenny
50:33) Are Beach Hoppers in danger? What happens if we lose them?
51:45) Are Beach Hoppers responsible for cleaning up all beach wrack, all over the world? Are there other organisms which serve the same purpose?
53:00) On to more generalized Q&A With Gabby & Josh
53:19) How do they decide on topics for videos?
55:40) What if an audience member had an idea for a show?
56:30) Wrap up, thanks and outro
